subject: Re: What is the equivalent of TestRunner in JUnit 3.8

messageBody:
Hi James,

Is there tool that I can invoke programmatically? We are not using
Maven. The issue is that we are working with Spring framework and in
our code, we have code that wraps Spring's unchecked exceptions with
checked exceptions. We used a Spring's SpringJUnit4ClassRunner before
but we can't do that. Hence my question.

Thanks,

Kartik

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> 2009/2/23 kartik_krishnanand <kartik_krishnanand@...>:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I have been using JUnit 4.x on my previous project. Now I have changed
> > companies and projects where the development team uses JUnit 3.8. Is
> > there a test runner equivalent that I can use?
> >
> > If not, is there a way I can create something like a test runner in
> > JUNit 3.8.
> >
> > Please let me know. Any help would be appreciated.
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Kartik
> >
>
> Hi,
>
> JUnit 3.x provides a CLI test runner, Swing and AWT options. Most IDEs
> will also run JUnit 3 tests and ANT and Maven will also run them for
> you. Spoilt for choice really!
>
> Cheers,
>
> James
>
